page.title: 06SHAKESPEARE'S HOME
page.content: Mary Ardens house is at Wilmcote. It was the home of William Shakespeare's mother and was built in 1410. It was a typical farm house of the time and still has the original furniture outside that is a museum housing historic farm implements. The property is owned by the Shakespeare birthplace Trust and is visited each year by one hundred thousand people of all nationalities. The house is open every day in the spring, summer and autumn but is closed on Sunday in the winter. An old barn has just been restored at the back of the property to form a new museum.
